pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:0.5: 19. The training rule on large dwellings
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.2: At that time a government official who was Venerable Channa’s supporter was making him a dwelling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.3: When the dwelling was finished, Channa had it roofed and plastered again and again.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.5: Then, while collecting grass and sticks, Channa spoiled the barley field belonging to a certain brahmin.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.6: That brahmin complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.7: “How can the venerables spoil my barley field?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.8: The monks heard the complaints of that brahmin,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.9: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized Channa,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.10: “How can Venerable Channa have a finished dwelling roofed and plastered again and again, so that it collapsed from overloading?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.11: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.12: “Is it true, Channa, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.15: “… Foolish man, how can you have a finished dwelling roofed and plastered again and again, so that it collapses from overloading?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.16: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.17: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:1.18.1: ‘When a monk is building a large dwelling, then standing where there are no cultivated plants, he may apply two or three courses of roofing material, taking it as far as the doorcase and using it for fixing the door and for treating the window openings. If he applies more than that, even if he stands where there are no cultivated plants, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.2: one with an owner is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.4: plastered inside or plastered outside or plastered both inside and outside.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.6: is building or is having built.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.8: a distance of an arm’s reach next to the door frame.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.10: for the fixing of the door.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.12: for treating the window openings there is white color, black color, and treating with red ocher; making a garland pattern, a creeper pattern, a shark-teeth pattern, and the fivefold pattern.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.13: Standing where there are no cultivated plants, he may apply two or three courses of roofing material:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.15: if he applies it while standing where there are cultivated plants, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.16: For someone covering in lines, after covering with two layers, he may ask for a third layer, and he should then depart.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.17: For someone covering in circles, after covering with two layers, he may ask for a third layer, and he should then depart.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.18: If he applies more than that, even if he stands where there are no cultivated plants:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.19: if he is covering with bricks, then for every brick, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.20: If he is covering with slate, then for every piece of slate, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.21: If he is covering with plaster, then for every lump, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.22: If he is covering with grass, then for every handful, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.1.23: If he is covering with leaves, then for every leaf, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.1: If it is more than two or three courses, and he perceives it as more, and he applies it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.2: If it is more than two or three courses, but he is unsure of it, and he applies it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.3: If it is more than two or three courses, but he perceives it as less, and he applies it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.4: If it is less than two or three courses, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.5: If it is less than two or three courses, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.2.6: If it is less than two or three courses, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.2: if he applies two or three courses;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.3: if he applies less than two or three courses;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.6: if it is a grass hut;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.7: if it is for the benefit of someone else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.8: if it is by means of his own property;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.9: if it is anything apart from a dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.11: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc19:2.3.12: The ninth rule, the training rule on large dwellings, is finished.
